item.title: Version 0.1.7
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: Just a couple of small updates tonight: Inputtie Version 0.1.7 (01/11/10) + Keys are now correctly depressed even if you use control + alt + escape + Hopefully better interaction when moving to screen edges
item.content:encoded:
Just a couple of small updates tonight:

Inputtie Version 0.1.7 (01/11/10)

+ Keys are now correctly depressed even if you use control + alt + escape
+ Hopefully better interaction when moving to screen edges

item.title: Version 0.1.6
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: A few small stability changes again in this version. Release notes are as follows: Inputtie Version 0.1.6 (25/10/10) + Inputtie now checks for updates every 12 hours + Mouse can now correctly reach all the way to the edge of … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
A few small stability changes again in this version.

Release notes are as follows:

Inputtie Version 0.1.6 (25/10/10)

+ Inputtie now checks for updates every 12 hours
+ Mouse can now correctly reach all the way to the edge of the screen
+ Mouse now remains in the last position it was before the connection closes

item.title: “Inputtie is a must-have application”
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: “Anyone who works on multiple computers should try Inputtie. It’s simple to set up and it’s mouse sharing feature have saved me countless hours.”Simon Jones. Company Director, Peppermint P
item.content:encoded:
“Anyone who works on multiple computers should try Inputtie.  It’s simple to set up and it’s mouse sharing feature have saved me countless hours.”
Simon Jones. Company Director, Peppermint P

item.title: Version 0.1.5
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: Just a few small changes in this update: From the release notes: Inputtie Version 0.1.5 (17/10/10) + Middle mouse input is now caught and transferred between devices + More errors are caught in the client + Keys are now depressed … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Just a few small changes in this update:

From the release notes:

Inputtie Version 0.1.5 (17/10/10)

+ Middle mouse input is now caught and transferred between devices
+ More errors are caught in the client
+ Keys are now depressed when a connection is cut, no more lingering Shift, yey!

item.title: Version 0.1.4
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: Just a small fix in this release to the mouse input capture code that seemed to have gone awry in the last patch, oops! Patch notes are: Inputtie Version 0.1.4 (28/03/10) + Fixed issues related to mouse input.
item.content:encoded:
Just a small fix in this release to the mouse input capture code that seemed to have gone awry in the last patch, oops!

Patch notes are:

Inputtie Version 0.1.4 (28/03/10)

+ Fixed issues related to mouse input.

item.title: Beta Release!
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: Woooo Hooo! Finally after almost a years worth of toiling we have finally released the beta version of Inputtie. Now we have only performed a limited amount of testing so im sure there are going to be bugs-a-plenty. If you … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Woooo Hooo! Finally after almost a years worth of toiling we have finally released the beta version of Inputtie.

Now we have only performed a limited amount of testing so im sure there are going to be bugs-a-plenty. If you find something we would love to hear about it. We dont currently have a dedicated email address you can use for this so just use the contact box on the side of this page to get in touch!

Anyways, here are the release notes for this version:

Inputtie Version 0.1.3 (22/03/10)
+ Beta Release!
+ Fixed an issue that was causing the mouse pointer to not quite reach the edge of the screen
+ Fixed it so that you can now choose not to show the “new device” help tip.
+ New Icons, yey!

Grab the download over on the download page now!

Oh BTW we decided to go with the “e” in a bordered square for our app icon:

item.title: Beta Draws Near!
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: Final testing is under way here at mission control for the Inputtie Beta. 1 Keyboard, 1 Mouse, 1 PC, 2 Laptops, 1 Netbook, 4 Operating Systems. All systems are go! Almost ready for takeoff!
item.content:encoded:
Final testing is under way here at mission control for the Inputtie Beta.

1 Keyboard, 1 Mouse, 1 PC, 2 Laptops, 1 Netbook, 4 Operating Systems.

All systems are go! Almost ready for takeoff!

item.title: Potential App Icons
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: With the beta for Inputtie drawing very near Oli and I are adding some final touches to the build and doing those “things we meant to do for ages”.  One of those things being the app icon. This is the … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
With the beta for Inputtie drawing very near Oli and I are adding some final touches to the build and doing those “things we meant to do for ages”.  One of those things being the app icon. This is the icon you will see on your shortcuts and in your taskbar area so its going to be pretty visible.

Oli, my partner-in-crime has whipped up 2 different versions with 2 variations on each version. See what you think:

I personally am favouring the circle icon with the border, however I worry that it looks too much like the Internet Explorer icon.

What do you all think?

Leave a comment below.

item.title: Homepage – Features Overview
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: One mouse & keyboard Control all devices with the mouse and keyboard of one computer. Simple to use Our user interface makes device management a piece of cake. Share clipboard Copy and paste content between all of your devices. Multi-platform … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
One mouse & keyboard

Control all devices with the mouse
and keyboard of one computer.

Simple to use

Our user interface makes device management a piece of cake.

Share clipboard

Copy and paste content between all of your devices.

Multi-platform

Seamlessly unite your Windows, Apple and Linux devices.
